name: Nausea
description: Nausea is a sensation of unease or discomfort in the stomach that may lead to vomiting. It can be caused by indigestion, infection, motion sickness, or certain medications.

mild.definition: Mild nausea without frequent vomiting or danger signs

high_risk.definition: Severe nausea or nausea with dehydration or neurological symptoms

self_care: Sip small amounts of clear fluids frequently
Eat bland foods like crackers or toast
Avoid strong smells and spicy foods
Take small frequent meals instead of large meals

medicines.name: Ondansetron 4mg Tablet
medicines.dose: Adults: 4 mg every 8 hours as needed

medicines.name: Domperidone 10mg Tablet
medicines.used_for: Relief of nausea due to indigestion
medicines.dose: Adults: 10 mg up to 3 times daily before meals

doctor_consultation.message: Seek medical attention if nausea is severe, persistent, or associated with dehydration, confusion, blood in vomit, or severe abdominal pain.

assessment_questions.question: How often are you experiencing nausea?
How many days have you had nausea?

disclaimer: This is educational information only and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Seek urgent care if symptoms are severe or worsening.
